stimulusHtml: Carlos finds a correlation of −.76 between outside temperature and degree of depression in a sample of 450 American citizens. Which of the following can be concluded from the research finding?
choicesHtml: Cold temperatures cause people to become depressed.
As outside temperature increases, people’s depression levels decrease.
No conclusions can be drawn because the sample was limited to only American citizens.
Depression can be alleviated with exposure to warm outside temperatures.
